ext_descriptions.ext_description: A padstack_arrangement lists the types of the padstack arrangement.
specifies that padstack is arranged from the top;
specifies that padstack is arranged from the bottom;
specifies that padstack is arranged symmetrically;
the transform specifies the for the Part_template_location_in_padstack_definition_transform.
the reference_location specifies the for the Part_template_location_in_padstack_definition_transform.
the template_shape specifies the for the Part_template_location_in_padstack_definition_transform.
the padstack_shape specifies the for the Part_template_location_in_padstack_definition_transform.
the reference_location shall be unique within a population of the Part_template_location_in_padstack_definition_transform.
A Part_template_planar_shape is a type of . A Part_template_planar_shape is the planar shape of a .

the reference_location specifies the role of the for the Padstack_location_in_footprint_definition_transform.
the footprint_shape specifies the for the Padstack_location_in_footprint_definition_transform.
the padstack_shape specifies the for the Padstack_location_in_footprint_definition_transform.

ext_description.p: A Part_template_planar_keepout_shape is a type of and a type of . A Part_template_planar_keepout_shape is the projected shape of a keepout region around the in two dimensions.
ext_description.note: Keepout regions typically include some minimal spacing around the extreme shape represented by where the exact relationship between the two shapes is unrecorded.

There may be multiple Part_template_planar_keepout_shape for a particular purpose. The recommended method to aggregate several Part_template_planar_keepout_shape that together describe a volumetric constraint is to reference them from a member of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: If exists, then it's size shall be one.

ext_description.note: The only identified use for this Application Object to reference a is to support a definition of an edge connector. The only known other possibility is for paste components.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the transform is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Padstack_location_in_footprint_definition is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Padstack_location_in_footprint_definition as its .
the reference_package_terminal specifies the for the Padstack_location_in_footprint_definition.
the footprint specifies the role of the for the Padstack_location_in_footprint_definition.
the padstack specifies the role of the for the Padstack_location_in_footprint_definition.
If the reference_package_terminal is a , the for that feature shall be the that is the for the footprint.
If the reference_package_terminal is a , the for that feature shall be the that is the for the footprint.
If the in the associated footprint is a , the reference_package_terminal shall be a .

ext_description.p: The location of the reference terminal specified by reference_package_terminal shall be commensurate with the transform in a geometric sense, that is the location of the terminal shall be such that "metal to metal" contact is assured.
ext_description.note: CAD system differences and idealization differences may prohibit mathematically exact co-location.

ext_description.p: A Part_template_location_in_padstack_definition is a . A Part_template_location_in_padstack_definition is the relationship that identifies the location of a in a . The Application Object references a in the formal model since there is a one to one relationship between a and the associated . There is exactly one allowed to reference a Part_template_location_in_padstack_definition. There is an optional reference to the parametric data necessary to define the shape of material to be added at the intersection of the padstack occurrence and the trace that intersects that occurrence. A parametric model is provided and not an explicit shape model because the actual angle the trace makes with respect to the padstack occurrence is unknown, and there may be more than one intersection. This model only provides support for one parametric configuration for this data for the Part_template_location_in_padstack_definition. In the event that trimming of a shape between the trace and the padstack occurrence is to be exchanged, the use of an instance in the design of is appropriate. If the transform attribute exists, then the parametric data shall not be provided. If the parametric data is provided, the transform shall not be provided.
ext_description.note: The is a geometric shape concept with the result that this requires exactly one shape for the used in a location.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the transform is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Part_template_location_in_padstack_definition is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Part_template_location_in_padstack_definition as its . There shall be zero or one for a Part_template_location_in_padstack_definition.
the reference_designation specifies the text that describes the Part_template_location_in_padstack_definition.
the template specifies the for the Part_template_location_in_padstack_definition.
the padstack specifies the for the Part_template_location_in_padstack_definition.
If transform is provided, then of of transform shall not be , or , or . If transform is not provided, then template shall be , or , or .

ext_description.p: A Footprint_definition is a type of . A Footprint_definition is a mating reference layout item for a specific shape. It identifies the reference shape, and a reference breakout. The reference breakout is only significant for the metal pattern that is on the top layer. The specific stackup for the reference breakout is of no significance. The is identified by a query on shape and then on the that references a . The location of the footprint is derived from the location of the that contribute to the Footprint_definition, and all that contribute to the Footprint_definition shall have the same location. The fact that a Footprint_definition is a for a bottom arrangement affects only the vertical stackup, that is what Padstack_definitions contribute to the Footprint_definition. The horizontal geometrical arrangement of the padstacks is identical for the top and bottom arrangements. The location of terminals that mate with the footprint in the case of a shall be consistent with the location of the elements of the footprint definition. The location of terminals of a printed part template shall be consistent with the location of the elements of the footprint definition.
ext_description.note: Mirroring of the geometrical arrangement of the padstacks in the footprint is accomplished using the mirror function in the that locates the occurrence of the Footprint_definition in the design.

It is expected that Vias and and will be used to support the reference layout, as well as copper shapes to suport getting from the mating contact to the breakout terminal. In the case of top surface breakout patterns, the join terminals of the reference layout which are typically Via terminals provide the capability to define the standard connection to the pattern. It is the usual case that there is only layout metal on the top layer.

It is not required or expected that the padstack_reference_implementation will be the same member of that is the assembly for the reference_breakout. The purpose of the padstack_reference_implementation is to facilitate the rule requiring a consistent among all the that contribute to the Footprint_definition.

While it is the case that in general a DERIVEd attribute may not be return a result, in the case of footprint_location and padstack_reference_implementation, it is required that they be calculable since the attributes they reference are mandatory.
A may be referenced by a Footprint_definition in the case where the Footprint_definition is providing material stackup and layout information for the .
The primary use for the reference to is for support of edge connectors.
ext_description.example: In the case of an edge connector definition, the complete definition when footprint definition is used would consist of a in association with a Footprint_definition. The Footprint_definition provides stackup information and the connector template provides terminal location and identification. The identification that a Footprint_definition is used will be accomplished by a reference from a to a which will reference the footprint definition.

ext_description.p: the padstack is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Footprint_definition is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Footprint_definition as its .
the shape is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Footprint_definition is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Footprint_definition as its .
the reference_package specifies a role of the for the Footprint_definition.
the reference_breakout specifies a role of the for the Footprint_definition. The reference_breakout is optional and may be an empty set.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The of padstacks of padstack shall be equal to footprint_location.
The of padstacks of padstack shall be padstack_reference_implementation.

A Padstack_definition is a type of . A Padstack_definition may be one of a or a , or additionally may be a .

the template is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Padstack_definition is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Padstack_definition as its . There shall be one or more for a Padstack_definition.
the shape is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Padstack_definition is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Padstack_definition as its .
the padstack_location specifies the for the Padstack_definition.
the reference_implementation specifies the for the Padstack_definition.
The refered by of shall be assigned by to at least one with 'template model'.

A Footprint_definition_shape is a type of . A Footprint_definition_shape is the planar shape of a . A Footprint_definition_shape may reference either a shape of a or a shape of a as a causal shape, with which the Footprint_definition_shape is to be compatible.
the reference_shape specifies the for the Footprint_definition_shape.

the shape_material_condition specifies the for the Footprint_definition_shape. The shape_material_condition specifies either the maximum_material_condition, the minimum_material_condition, or the nominal_material_condition as the material condition for the Footprint_definition_shape.

the shape_environment specifies the for the Footprint_definition_shape. The shape_environment specifies either manufacturing or an end_user_application as the valid environment for the Footprint_definition_shape. The shape_environment need not be specified for a particular Footprint_definition_shape.
the shape_characterized_footprint_definition specifies the role of the for the Footprint_definition_shape.
the shape_characterized_footprint_definition shall be unique within a population of the Footprint_definition_shape.
If the reference_shape is a or a , then the same package shall be referenced by the shape_characterized_footprint_definition and by the reference_shape.
If the reference_shape is a or a , then only a shall be referenced by the reference_shape.
If the reference_shape is a or a , then the same shall be referenced by the shape_characterized_footprint_definition and by the reference_shape.
If the reference_shape is a or a , then only a shall be referenced by the by the reference_shape.
Footprint_definition_shape shall not be referenced by as .
A Design_layer_type_specific_padstack_definition is a type of that applies to all design layers in a design to which it is applied.
the design_layer_type_reference specifies the for the Design_layer_type_specific_padstack_definition.
A Stratum_type_independent_padstack_definition is a type of that shall be applied to all of a design, irrespective of the type of individual .
A Padstack_definition_shape is a type of . A Padstack_definition_shape is the planar shape of a .

the shape_material_condition specifies the for the Padstack_definition_shape. The shape_material_condition specifies either the maximum_material_condition, the minimum_material_condition, or the nominal_material_condition as the material condition for the Padstack_definition_shape.

the shape_environment specifies the for the Padstack_definition_shape. The shape_environment specifies either manufacturing or an end_user_application as the valid environment for the Padstack_definition_shape. The shape_environment need not be specified for a particular Padstack_definition_shape.
the shape_characterized_padstack_definition specifies the role of the for the Padstack_definition_shape.
the shape_characterized_padstack_definition shall be unique within a population of the Padstack_definition_shape.
Padstack_definition_shape shall not be referenced by as .
